perturbation.original_text: Each party will indemnify, defend and hold harmless the other party and its respective directors, officers, members, employees, licensees, agents and independent contractors, from and against any claim or action, liability, damages, and expense, including but not limited to attorney’s fees, arising from or resulting from (i) the negligent act or omission of the party, its employees, agents or contractors, (ii) the party’s breach of this Agreement, or (iii) the violation of any law by the party, its employees, agents, or contractors. Reed’s will indemnify, defend and hold harmless Company and its directors, officers, members, employees, licensees, agents and independent contractors, from and against any claims for the breach of the intellectual property rights of a third party based on the Reed’s Intellectual Property. Company will indemnify defend and hold harmless Reed’s and its directors, officers, members, employees, licensees, agents and independent contractors, from and against any claims for the breach of the intellectual property rights of a third party based on the Company Intellectual Property, Deliverables and Work Product, except as such claims are solely based on or limited to the Reed’s Intellectual Property.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party will indemnify, defend and hold harmless the other party and its respective directors, officers, members, employees, licensees, agents and independent contractors, from and against any claim or action, liability, damages, and expense, arising from or resulting from (i) the negligent act or omission of the party, its employees, agents or contractors, or (ii) the party’s breach of this Agreement. Reed’s will indemnify, defend and hold harmless Company and its directors, officers, members, employees, licensees, agents and independent contractors, from and against any claims for the breach of the intellectual property rights of a third party based on the Reed’s Intellectual Property. Company will indemnify defend and hold harmless Reed’s and its directors, officers, members, employees, licensees, agents and independent contractors, from and against any claims for the breach of the intellectual property rights of a third party based on the Company Intellectual Property, Deliverables and Work Product, except as such claims are solely based on or limited to the Reed’s Intellectual Property.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause '(iii) the violation of any law by the party, its employees, agents, or contractors' from the indemnification obligations, the contract no longer explicitly requires indemnification for legal violations. This weakens the protection for the other party and may violate laws requiring companies to be responsible for violations caused by them.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various state and federal laws related to corporate liability and responsibility for legal violations.

perturbation.original_text: In addition to any other legal or equitable remedies that may be available, either party will be able to obtain immediate injunctive relief in the form of a temporary restraining order, preliminary injunction or permanent injunction against the other party to enforce the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: In addition to any other legal or equitable remedies that may be available, either party may pursue legal action against the other party to enforce the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit mention of 'immediate injunctive relief in the form of a temporary restraining order, preliminary injunction or permanent injunction', the contract makes it less clear that parties have access to this swift legal remedy. Injunctive relief is an important legal tool, and omitting it could violate laws requiring parties to be able to seek quick remedies for contract breaches.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of contract law related to equitable remedies and the right to seek injunctions.

perturbation.original_text: The parties agree that any claim or dispute arising under this Agreement shall be resolved by a court located in New York City, New York.
perturbation.changed_text: The parties agree that any claim or dispute arising under this Agreement may be resolved in a location convenient to Reed's.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the venue clause to a location convenient to Reed's and removing the specifier of New York City, New York it potentially violates laws related to fairness in dispute resolution and access to justice. Forcing Company to litigate in a location solely convenient to Reed's could create an undue burden, especially if Company is an Oregon-based entity, potentially violating Oregon's or federal regulations on fair business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State and federal laws related to fairness in contract terms, forum selection clauses, and access to justice.
